resources.name: An Online Catalog of Human Genes and Genetic Disorders

externalReferences.description: Identification of a novel and functional mutation in the TBX5 gene in a patient by screening from 354 patients with isolated ventricular septal defect

query:
From the following patient information, what is the most likely diagnosis? Use multiple queries or reasoning steps as necessary, and provide a rank-ordered list of up to 10 diagnoses, even if there is insufficient information to make a definitive diagnosis. If you are unsure, provide a list of possible diagnoses with the most likely one first.

Patient ID: a 6-month-old female
Patient age: Unknown
Patient sex: Female
Patient features: Pulmonary arterial hypertension (onset 9 months), Perimembranous ventricular septal defect.
Excluded patient features: Secundum atrial septal defect, Muscular ventricular septal defect, Complete atrioventricular canal defect, Patent foramen ovale, Absent thumb, Short thumb, Triphalangeal thumb, Absent radius, Upper limb phocomelia.

function.arguments: {"search_terms": ["Secundum atrial septal defect", "Muscular ventricular septal defect", "Complete atrioventricular canal defect", "Patent foramen ovale", "Absent thumb", "Short thumb", "Triphalangeal thumb", "Absent radius", "Upper limb phocomelia"]}

messages.content: {'result_as_graph': {'type': 'graph', 'data': {'nodes': [{'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0020428', 'caption': 'congenital Gerbode defect', 'name': 'congenital Gerbode defect', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0007345', 'caption': 'aorta coarctation', 'name': 'aorta coarctation', 'description': 'Congenital narrowing of a segment of the aorta. Signs and symptoms include hypertension, muscle weakness, shortness of breath, headaches and leg cramps.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0007732', 'caption': 'Holt-Oram syndrome', 'name': 'Holt-Oram syndrome', 'description': 'Holt-Oram syndrome (HOS) is the most common form of heart-hand syndrome and is characterized by skeletal abnormalities of the upper limbs and mild-to-severe congenital cardiac defects.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0957991', 'caption': 'ciliary dyskinesia, primary, 53', 'name': 'ciliary dyskinesia, primary, 53', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0013262', 'caption': 'dilated cardiomyopathy 1S', 'name': 'dilated cardiomyopathy 1S', 'description': 'Any familial isolated dilated cardiomyopathy in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the MYH7 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0010457', 'caption': 'Ogden syndrome', 'name': 'Ogden syndrome', 'description': 'Ogden syndrome is a rare, genetic progeroid syndrome characterized by a variable phenotype including postnatal growth delay, severe global developmental delay, hypotonia, non-specific dysmorphic facies with aged appearance and cryptorchidism, as well as cardiac arrthymias and skeletal anomalies. Patients typically present with widely opened fontanels, mainly truncal hypotonia, a waddling gait with hypertonia of the extremities, small hands and feet, broad great toes, scoliosis and redundant skin with lack of subcutaneous fat.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}], 'edges': []}}, 'result_as_table': {'type': 'table', 'data': []}}
messages.name: run_query

function.name: run_query
function.arguments:
{"query":"MATCH (d:biolink_Disease)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(p1:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0002092'})
WITH d
MATCH (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(p2:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0011682'})
WHERE NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0001684'})
AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0011623'})
AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0001674'})
AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0001655'})
AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0009777'})
AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0009778'})
AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0001199'})
AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0003974'})
AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {id: 'HP:0009813'})
RETURN d LIMIT 10"}

Signs and symptoms include hypertension, muscle weakness, shortness of breath, headaches and leg cramps.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0013262', 'caption': 'dilated cardiomyopathy 1S', 'name': 'dilated cardiomyopathy 1S', 'description': 'Any familial isolated dilated cardiomyopathy in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the MYH7 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}], 'edges': []}}, 'result_as_table': {'type': 'table', 'data': []}}

messages.content:
Based on the provided patient features (pulmonary arterial hypertension and perimembranous ventricular septal defect) and the exclusion of several other cardiac and limb anomalies, here is a rank-ordered list of possible diagnoses from the Monarch knowledge graph:

### Most Likely Diagnoses

1. **[Congenital Gerbode defect](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0020428)**
   - This is a rare congenital heart defect involving an abnormal communication between the left ventricle and right atrium, which can be associated with pulmonary hypertension and septal defects.

2. **[Aorta coarctation](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0007345)**
   - This is a congenital narrowing of the aorta, which can lead to hypertension and may be associated with other cardiac defects, though it is less specifically linked to perimembranous VSD.

3. **[Dilated cardiomyopathy 1S](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0013262)**
   - This is a genetic form of dilated cardiomyopathy, which can present with pulmonary hypertension and sometimes septal defects, but is less specific for the features described.

### Notes

- No results were found that matched all included features and excluded all the specified features with absolute certainty, but the above diagnoses are the closest matches in the Monarch knowledge graph.
- Diagnoses such as Holt-Oram syndrome and Ogden syndrome were excluded because they are typically associated with upper limb anomalies, which are specifically absent in this patient.
- If you need more information or a broader list, let me know!

If you would like to explore the phenotypic features or genetic associations of these conditions, I can provide more details.
